page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: The block comprises open land;either arable or grazing.The few dwellings are farms,manor houses,and isolated cottages or small houses,some of which were lodges for the manors.The manors and farms are privately owned,except for Offley Grange,and Wellbury which is now a Boys' Home run by a charity. There are villages nearby;Offley, Pirton and Lilley.The towns of Hitchin and Luton are less than 10 miles away. There is much of historical interest, including the Icknield Way and a Domesday entry for Wellbury. The following pages have entries for:_ Pegsdon Common and Offley Grange farms and High Down House.Life at Wellbury House and East Lodge,Little Offley,and pheasant rearing at Little Offley farm.Two'day accounts'from people within the block and a bird survey for summer 1985.
